In this CL, the Campaigns Manager session load campaigns component at

session active and try to trigger proactive campaign when campaigns

component is loaded.

entry.title: Move FontConfig initialization off of the UI thread
entry.content:
Recent versions of FontConfig are thread-safe. Since FontConfig

initialization takes a long time (30ms to 100ms on my machine), it

should be done off the UI thread to prevent blocking startup. This is

the strategy Pango uses to initialize FontConfig.



This CL is the first in a series to address the issue. There are two

uses of FontConfig early in initialization that need to be moved later.

I have WIP changes that address both of these and reduce startup time on

Linux and ChromeOS by 30ms to 100ms.



R=thestig



Change-Id: Id24a00c494c67e02d657ad9b25bc8d343da9d983

Bug: 1523810

entry.title: Reland "[exo] Introduce OutputController to wayland::Server"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 0649147cf5be8859ab3bd70690c333c06cc465fa



See diff against patchset 1.



Updated to fix lifetime issues:

- destroy the created wl_display at the end of each test

- wait for the async-destroy task for WaylandDisplayOutput to run



Original change's descripgtion:

> [exo] Introduce OutputController to wayland::Server

>

> This is purely a refactor and no behavior changes are expected.

>

> This CL introduces a new OutputController class to wayland::Server.

> OutputController encapsulates the responsibility of managing the

> server-side view of wayland output objects.

>

> This includes

> - Initializing global output state during server startup

> - Keeping output state consistent with system Display state

> - Notifying wayland clients of output changes (metrics / activation)

>

> Adds a few tests. Follow up CLs will add more tests, adding a cleaner

> interface for the WaylandDisplayOutput class.

>

> Bug: 1518335

entry.title: [HitTestOpaqueness] Fix unreliable scroll on fixed-position layer
entry.content:
A fixed-position layer's scroll tree index is the inner viewport

scroll node, while InputHandler::InputHandler::GetNodeToScroll()

may return the outer viewport scroll node. Due to the difference,

we should check equality of scroll node by calling GetNodeToScroll

for both `layer_impl` and

`first_scrollable_or_opaque_to_hit_test_layer`. The previous code

caused unreliable hit test if a hit-tested fixed-position layer was

opaque to hit test.



Bug: 1413877

Change-Id: I15ba3f4e857480daa1111feac6b48ae904ec0bc8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5256145

Reviewed-by: Steve Kobes

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1255254}

entry.title: [soft navigations] Refactor APIs to remove ScriptState
entry.content:
ScriptState is being used in soft navigations APIs for 2 reasons, both

of which can be removed:

1. To get the TaskAttributionTracker::RunningTask(). This previously

needed ScriptState to get the continuation data (CPED), but now

only requires a v8::Isolate, which we can get from the execution

context. This CL adds a RunningTask(v8::Isolate*) variant, which

is used to remove the dependence on ScriptState from soft nav APIs.

(The rest will be converted in a follow-up).



2. To call ToLocalFrameIfNotDetached(), isn't needed since

SoftNavigationHeuristics is tied to a window, which we can use to

get the frame directly.



This CL removes the unnecessary usage of ScriptState from

SoftNavigationHeuristics, and refactors its APIs to remove the

dependence.



Bug: 1351643

entry.title: Disable PlusAddresses when the first poll requests fail with 403.
entry.content:
The existing behavior continues to offer the feature even if each

request fails with a 403. The users that experience this are not

enrolled to use the feature, so we can disable the feature

entirely for them.



Before this CL:

Repeated 403s do not cause changes in PlusAddresses.



After this CL:

If the first poll fails with a 403, we retry it once.

If it never succeeds, we disable the PlusAddressService which

prevents any PlusAddress offerings or further network requests.



This CL adds this behavior behind a new feature flag parameter.



Bug: 1467623, b/318357301

entry.title: Support base::Token in Java for native interop
entry.content:
For our tab group efforts this year in Chrome for Android we would like

to support better interop between the desktop and Android representation

of a TabGroup. Presently Chrome on Android does not have the notion of

a "stable" tab group identifier. To align with desktop we plan to

adopt the TabGroupId used in desktop for Chrome on Android. TabGroupId

is a thin wrapper around base::Token.



To ensure smoothness of back and forth traversal across the JNI layer,

this CL creates a base::Token equivalent in Java with an API matching

the native. This CL also creates helper methods for cross JNI boundary

Token passing.



The Java version of token relies on the native implementation for

createRandom() to ensure a high-quality randomness source is used. All

the other methods are available directly in Java to support working

with tokens in Java prior to native initialization assuming they

were previously serialized and new tokens don't need to be created.



Bug: 1523745

Change-Id: I81ce311db1f37170755ebb1f766b3e3570b4aa03

entry.title: Update the DelayOnFramePresent feature on Mac
entry.content:
This CL moves ApplyBackpressure() and CommitPendingTreesToCA() into

ImageTransportSurfaceOverlayMacEGL::PopulateCALayerParameters()



With this feature, the CALayerTree is no longer committed to

CoreAnimation immediately in

ImageTransportSurfaceOverlayMacEGL::Present(). Now it waits for

CVDisplayCallback before it calls PopulateCALayerParameters(). In the

case of more than one pending frame, the previous frame is committed

immediately when the next frame is ready.

entry.title: Lock down access to LayoutSuperclass<>() and verify protections.
entry.content:
It's not possible to enforce at compile-time that LayoutSuperclass<>()

is only called while a layout is being processed, so enforce that at

runtime instead, and verify that enforcement with a death test.



This also adds nocompile tests that verify the PassKey protections on

Layout().



As a result, it should be impossible to improperly Layout() directly

from tests, so the presubmits blocking that are removed.

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Check for a comma before calling #getAccessibleBoundary.
entry.content:
When text is too long, commas are going to be the best place to

break the text in most cases for languages that use commas.



Therefore, check for a comma before calling into C++

with #getAccessibleBoundary. #getAccessibleBoundary will still

continue to be used in cases where there are no commas.

entry.title: Always report ORB issues for requests with Attribution headers
entry.content:
Currently, ORB issues are not surfaced for requests with an empty

response, as in theory a blocked response should not result in

any web-visible differences in behavior.



However, requests which contain Attribution Reporting headers

will result in web-visible differences when blocked by ORB, so

ideally these would be reported to issues.

entry.title: [SAA] Implementing SharedWorker support (Part 2: Expose same-site cookie IDL)
entry.content:
The Storage Access API provides access to unpartitioned cookies in

third-party contexts. This CL is part of a series to extend that access

to SharedWorkers.



Before we actually provide access to SharedWorkers, we need a way for

the renderer to limit the scope of SameSite cookies provided to the

worker. Normally, a worker with a first-party storage key could access

all cookies, but if access is via the SAA handle we want to limit that

access to just SameSite: None cookies.



This CL is part of a series to allow that limiting ability. For now, we

expose the option in IDL but do not implement the change needed to limit

cookie access in first-party contexts when the option is set to 'none'.

The next CL will implement this limit.



Note: The ability to request 'all' in a third-party context is not added

here nor will it be added. We verify that an exception is thrown if this

is attempted.



Explainer:

https://privacycg.github.io/saa-non-cookie-storage/shared-workers.html



Part 1: Expose same-site cookie IPC

Part 2: Expose same-site cookie IDL

Part 3: Implement same-site cookie filtering

Part 4: Add SharedWorker support to SAA handle



Bug: 1484966

Change-Id: I8c56c02025950e119e3967afd49ed684446fd6e3

entry.content:
Service workers do not support keepalive requests. These responses must

therefore continue being handled in blink.



In this CL, we identify responses to keepalive requests sent from a

service workers and process them in blink even if the in-browser

migration is enabled.

entry.title: Replace .com/.org in ContextRecycler tests.
entry.content:
In particular, replace example.org with example.test (which is the fake

bidder worklet's origin in these tests), and example.com with

example2.test. Also replace some instances of "example/com" with

"example2.test", as it's almost certainly a typo, and the string

doesn't really matter.



The motivation for this change is that tests should generally use

*.test domain names, to avoid accidentally depending on real domains.

*.test is reserved, so should never match a "real" domain name.

e.g., if a DNS lookup ever makes it to a public DNS server, we could

accidentally depend on the existence, or even the response of, a

real server on the web, which tests shouldn't be depending on. It could

even result in a security vulnerability in the test bots, in theory.

clarify the current behavior.

entry.title: download: Reduce max display URL size in about://downloads
entry.content:
Currently the max display URL size in about://downloads is 2M, which is

too big for a string only for display purposes. It's causing slow page

load and JavaScript errors like "Maximum call stack size exceeded".



This CL reduces the max display URL size from 2M to 16K, which should be

sufficient for most cases.



Manually tested by saving a video frame from a 4K video using the "Save

video frame as" context menu, and when inspecting about://downloads in

dev console, observed that the display URL size is 16384.



Bug: 1522764

entry.title: Reland "Fix browser system media controls not going away."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 7b663207a1705e7cf7c630a665e35b879f42f797



The cause of the revert was flakiness in WebAppSystemMediaControlsBrowserTest.BrowserAndWebAppTest. This change will improve reliabiliy of that test.



Original change's description:

> Fix browser system media controls not going away.

>

> With #enable-web-app-system-media-controls-win, system media controls

> for the browser was not going away when the last tab playing audio was

> closed.

>

> Furthermore, with #enable-web-app-system-media-controls-win enabled, when one tab playing audio is closed - the

> browser smc was not able to fall back to other tabs playing audio.

>

> This change reworks instanced system media controls to utilize an active

> media session controller that follows the active browser sessions while

> ignoring web app sessions. This allows the browser to continue to use

> an AMSC that follows the active session, thus restoring fallback and

> automatic dismissal when browser sessions are closed.

>

> **For security/mojo review**:

>

> These changes are part of this design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/12dVKreUCjtZZaUqeh3VxGMsGPMC4POhK/edit

>

> We originally did not anticipate any mojo changes for this feature, but in order to fix the bug outlined in this CL - we needed to make this small change.

>

> The mojo changes do not intend to change any existing structure of information passing - only that services/media_session/audio_focus_manager needs to take different action based on a flag set from content/browser/media/session/media_session_impl.

>

> The purpose of this flag is essentially to mark the media session as for web apps - thus causing it not to be eligible to become the 'active session'. The reason this is desirable is because web app sessions are tracked separately by an "ActiveMediaSessionController" that specifically follows one session and does not follow around an active session.

>

> The user of an "ActiveMediaSessionController" that follows the active session is only the browser - where all tabbed browser media sessions bubble up to one singular concept of "the media the browser is currently playing". Thus needs to change based on what the user interacted with most recently. In other words, we do not want a web apps' media session to show up in the browser's singleton instance when the web app is activated, used or updated.

>

> Bug: 1517758

> Change-Id: Ic4839bbca89d4d743ca406d4439d396ae69de9e8

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5235430

> Reviewed-by: Tommy Steimel

> Commit-Queue: Stanley Hon

> Reviewed-by: Sam McNally

> Reviewed-by: Frank Liberato

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254143}



Bug: 1517758

entry.title: Address clang-tidy findings in //content/browser/interest_group
entry.content:
* Prevent UB division by zero with a CHECK. Perhaps impossible at

runtime, but I am choosing to be pedantic.

https://timsong-cpp.github.io/cppwp/n4659/expr.mul



* Fix accidental use-after-move in InterestGroupAuctionReporter

constructor. Not sure if the behavior is defined.



* Some return values are currently only used when DCHECK is enabled.

Style guide prefers CHECK anyway, so I'm upgrading the DCHECKs to

CHECKs rather than adding [[maybe_unused]] annotations.



Relevant section from chromium C++ style guide:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/styleguide/c++/c++.md#check_dcheck_notreached_noreturn_and-notreached

entry.title: document-pip: Use title from opener for the pip browser window
entry.content:
Currently, the system-level window title of a document

picture-in-picture window is "about:blank", since the active

WebContents in a document pip window is a blank document. This isn't a

useful title for us to use, and in certain cases can cause user

confusion. This CL changes the document picture-in-picture window to

instead be titled based on its opener's title.

entry.title: Disallow keyboard navigation to non-focusable elements.
entry.content:
Presently, the keyboard navigation navigation does not differentiate

between focusable (interactable) and non-focusable elements, making a

bizarre stops while navigating the suggestions list.

navigation will skip over non-focusable views (e.g. suggestion

entry.title: desk_profiles: Clean up desk profile setting from DeskProfilesButton
entry.content:
The button was previously modifying the lacros profile ID on the desk it

was associated with *if* the desk had the lacros profile ID 0. It also

meant that a newly created desk would have ID 0 until the user brings up

the desk bar.



It was always quite weird to have the button be responsible for updating

the profile ID of the desk. The zero ID was also intended to be an alias

for the primary user.



This CL removes the code from the button and makes sure that the desk

profiles delegate properly treats ID 0 as an alias for the primary user.



BUG=b:323233683

entry.title: Reland "autotest.py: Support policy to pref mappings tests"
entry.content:
This relands commit e7481c50566157a6f84fd7c3fc8a9cc7bf694d89.

Which was reverted in commit dc8e02663bd4f9dc83f88b71d01b98f1f72e653a.



There was an issue in the original CL where the argument

--test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter gets popuplated when there are no

policy pref mapping test files. This wasn't noticed because c++ unit

tests and browser tests ignore this flag and work correctly. Android

tests OTOH throw an error because the flag is unknown.



This CL filters policy pref mapping files when building the flag.



Original change's description:

> autotest.py: Support policy to pref mappings tests

>

> Pref mapping test files now work, for example:

> $ tools/autotest.py -C out/Default \

> components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping/NewWindowsInKioskAllowed.json

> $ tools/autotest.py -C out/Default \

> components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping \

> --test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter=NewWindowsInKioskAllowed

>

> Which are equivalent to:

> $ autoninja -C out/Default browser_tests

> $ out/Default/browser_tests \

> --gtest_filter="*PolicyPrefsTest.PolicyToPrefsMapping" \

> --test_policy_to_pref_mappings_filter="NewWindowsInKioskAllowed"

>

> Bug: b:319254568

> Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping

> Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default components/policy/test/data/pref_mapping/NewWindowsInKioskAllowed.json

entry.title: Log to Devtools browser-side failed trigger registrations
entry.content:
With the in-browser migration, triggers are now parsed in the browser.



With this change:

- When a parsing error is encountered in the browser, a Devtools issue

is logged and an event is emitted to the

Conversions.TriggerRegistrationError9 histogram.



- When a non suitable reporting origin is encountered, a Devtools issue

is logged.



This CL brings issue logging from the browser on par with issue logging

from blink. The `http/tests/inspector-protocol/attribution-reporting` WPT tests suite now runs with the in-browser migration enabled.

entry.title: [iOSKAUpgrade] Fix alert coordinator is being dismissed too soon
entry.content:
The FormInputAccessoryCoordinator's `reset` method does several things,

one of which is stopping all child coordinators. Triggering the `reset`

method when the keyboard accessory view disappears, caused an issue with

alerts. When an alert was presented (such as the one shown before

accessing the list of saved passwords), the keyboard accessory would

disappear, and `reset` would be called. The alert coordinator would then

be stopped, and the alert would automatically disappear from the screen.



This CL fixes the issue by performing every action that's done in

`reset`, except the one stopping the child coordinators when the

keyboard accessory disappears. Stopping the child view controllers at

this point is not necessary. Resetting the keyboard accessory and the

`formInputViewController` is really what's important here.



Bug: 1501851

Change-Id: I711dc87273012542724d80eec2fa8206e0c73ea8

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Don't check for maximum text length if using a local voice.
entry.content:
The maximum text length checks were built as a workaround for

crbug.com/1176078, but this bug only impacts remote voices.

Therefore, since these checks can slightly degrade Read Aloud

experience by splitting speech, don't use these checks if not

needed.



I've manually verified that adding this check for local voices

continues to split text as expected on Linux (to avoid the crash)

and does not split text on ChromeOS (where no crash is expected).

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Move blocking dequeue to dedicated threads
entry.content:
VIDIOC_DQBUF calls are blocking. They wait for a buffer to be

done processing. |CreateSequencedTaskRunner| can share a thread.

When thread usage goes up, these blocking calls prevent other

task runners from working.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Add double-tile view.
entry.content:
This CL adds multi-tile view support to the Tab Resumption Module.

Noting that the number of shown suggestion tiles is capped at 2, so now

we'd have double-tile view or single-tile view (when there is only 1

valid suggestion). Details:

* Add tab_resumption_module_multi_tile_layout.xml: Layout of a small

tile for the multi-tile view. It has 2 TextView instead of 3 for the

single-tile case.

* Add tab_resumption_module_divider.xml: Layout of a divider.

* TabResumptionTileView: Add setSuggestionTextsMulti().

* TabResumptionTileContainerView:

* Update loadTileTexts() to take `isSingle` param, to selectively

render strings and call setSuggestionTexts{Single,Multi}().

* Update renderAllTiles() to visit all SuggestionEntry instances to

create TabResumptionTileView instances, also inserting a divider

between them.

* Update removeAllViews() to call destroy() only on

TabResumptionTileView instances, noting that tiles alternate with

dividers.



Tests:

* TabResumptionModuleMediatorUnitTest: Replace Activity usage with

ApplicationProvider, and update testTakeMostRecent() to account for

loading of a second image.

* TabResumptionModuleViewUnitTest: Add testRenderDouble() for the final

rendering stage where there are 2 tiles.

entry.title: IDB: prevent clients from evicting selves from BFCache
entry.content:
This change fixes most cases where a single client (render

frame) would cause itself to be disallowed from BFCache.

For example, if a single client creates two transactions A

and B, with A blocking B, this is no longer grounds for

disallowing BFCache.



To accomplish this, IndexedDB browser code becomes aware

of the identity of clients by way of an unguessable token

generated for each IndexedDBClientStateChecker. This token

is stored on the IndexedDBConnection as well as the

PartitionedLockHolder, so that methods like

`IsTransactionBlockingOthers()` can prevent same-client

IDB-scope-blocking relationships from ruling a client out of

BFCache.



This change also has the effect that a transaction that is

waiting on a lock will not be ruled out of BFCache. If this

client enters BFCache and then becomes unblocked, at that

point it may be evicted, but only if it is blocking other

clients.

entry.title: Rename CanonicalCookie::IsSecure to SecureAttribute
entry.content:
CanonicalCookie::IsSecure() is a simple getter that returns if a

cookie's "Secure" attribute was set or not.



I.e.: Set-Cookie: "foo=bar; Secure"



With the introduction of "source_scheme" a cookie could also be

considered secure if their setting scheme was secure. To try and help

reduce potential confusion this CL renames IsSecure() to

SecureAttribute() to hopefully indicate that this is a getter and not a

function which is trying to answer the question "was this cookie created

in a secure context?".



This CL is a simple renaming and does not change any logic.

entry.title: [iOS][Omnibox][Textfield] Fix text alignment in RTL
entry.content:
Fix text alignment in mix RTL/LTR.



The defaultTextAttributes from UITextField contains writing direction

and alignments attributes. These attributes are updated by UIKit when

the text is updated.

In pre edit state handling, modify the attributes from the existing

UIKit dictionary instead of creating a new one.



Also:

- Returns the textfield's semanticContentAttribute when text direction

is NSWritingDirectionNatural.

- Exit pre edit in will change to avoid overriding the text attributes

from the new text.
